shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” for the entire year (fols. 1ra-175va), incomplete I-1) Mäskäräm (fols. 1ra-19vb) I-2) Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 20ra-38rb) I-3) Ḫǝdar (fols. 38va-59va) I-4) Ṭǝrr (fols. 60ra-85vb) I-5) Yäkkatit (fols. 86ra-104ra) I-6) Mäggabit (fols. 104ra-129ra) I-7) Miyazya (fols. 129rb-143rb) I-8) Gǝnbot (fols. 144ra-158vb) I-9) Säne (fols. 160va-166vb) I-10) Ḥamle (fols. 167ra–174va) I-11) Näḥase (fols. 159rb-159va, 174va-175va).

txstates.txstate: The binding of the Ms. is missing. The textblock is held together with a metal wire. Some fols. are missing, some are misplaced. Many fols. are heavily damaged by water, insects and rodents (partly with loss of text, e.g., fols. 118-120; 130-135). Larger portions of the text are difficult to read (e.g., fols. 24v-41r, 53v-63r). Fols. 76 and 81 are cut in the bottom margin. A few holes and tears carefully amended (e.g., fols. 7, 23, 41, 46, 127). A few holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires close to the tail (e.g., fols. 91, 163).

bindings.binding: The original binding of the Ms. is missing.

bnothers.bnother: Some quires are reinforced with parchment guards, visible on the spine fold and inside the Ms. (fols. 13r, 75r,76r, 77r, 102r, 129r, 137r, 159r, 160r, 166v [small dark strip, resp.]).

squires.squire: Quire structure cannot be identified due to the poor condition of the Ms.

taunit.ln-info: The number of lines varies from 26 (fol. 7ra) up to 31 (fol. 177rb).
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand:
The script shows palaeographic features of the 16th cent. and some older features: - form of 'four' (፬,triangular downwards -oriented) - form of 'six' (፮,looking like "compressed" number 'seven') - 'ten' (፲) occasionally appears in the form with a ring (e.g., fols. 47ra, 49rb, 60ra, 98va, 111vb, 148vb) or with a dot (e.g., fols. 110va, 111ra) on the right side of the sign's body - the marker of the 6th vowel order ው appears with stroke at the top, not in the middle (conspicuous esp. at the very beginning of the Ms.) - vowel marker of ን is a short horizontal stroke with serif, in some cases directed upwards - ይ with a wide curve - ጵ hook vowel marker is attached to the left side of the letter's body (e.g., fol. 42vb, l. 20) or to the vertical stroke (e.g., fol. 12vab) - coronis-signs are used as macrocaesura in fol. 38rb, 85vb, 143rb. Other features: - broadly spaced letters - tendency to keep open vocalization loops of the 5th order - tendency towards a separation of loops of መ - the characters ወ, መ, ሠ are often formed on a slant, the lower left side extends to the base line while the upper right part extends to the upper limit - ሣ the left loop is of smaller size - መ of smaller size than other characters - ሎ in some cases the vowel marker is attached directly to the downstroke at the upper part (e.g., fols. 5rb, 8vb).
For palaeographic features of the hand, s. UhlPal 95, 212, 300-424. For the form of 'ten' (፲) with a ring, s. UM-049; cp. also A. DILLMANN, Ethiopic Grammar, London 1907, 33 (§16).

otherdetails.otherdetail:
The Ms. is incomplete; numerous fols. are missing: - Mäskäräm: 1st-7th are missing - Taḫśaś: entire month is missing - Yäkkatit: 10th, 26th-27th are missing - Miyazya: 3rd, 28th-30th are missing; two entries for 25th but none for 24th, but entry in fol. 141rb-vb belongs apparently to 24th (see: : ColSyn XII 570-574) - Gǝnbot: 15th-16th are missing. 30th is incomplete - Säne: 1st-14th; 16th-19th are missing - Ḥamle: 1st, 6th-8th, 11th-16th, 19th-28th are missing - Näḥase: 4th-16th, 19th-30th are missing - Ṗagwǝmen: entire month is missing. The text is laid out in two columns, possibly a typical feature of Synaxarion ma nuscript before the mid-16th cent. (three columns were introduced later).
Fol. 60, containing part of the entry for 8th Ṭǝrr, is misplaced. In fol. 98 the commemorative date is partly rubbed out (፲ወ?): - mentioned are here: abba Sawiros, abba Yaʿqob; commemorated on 14th Yäkkatit (see: ColSyn X 542-546) - however, the commemorative notices for 14th Yäkkatit are written on fol. 97ra-98ra; here, abba Ṭimote (Timothy Patriarch of Alexandria) among others is mentioned who is commemorated on 13th Yäkkatit (see: ColSyn X 536-537).
The text differs significantly from the published/edited versions (GUIDI-COLIN, BUDGE, recent Ethiopian church edition) in terms of language, e.g., spelling of names (persons and places, e.g., fol. 11va: Qǝwsṭos instead of Qwäsṭänṭinos [Constantine], fol. 12ra: ʾAtnatyos instead of ʾAtnasyos [Athanasius]) and in terms of content. Some entries are much shorter (e.g., 23th Miyazya – George of Lydda, fols. 141va-141ra) and not all saints of the universal church are mentioned (like St. Qirqos, 15th Ṭǝrr). The Ethiopian saints like ʾƎwoṭaṭewos (18th Mäskäräm), Gäbrä Mänfäs Qeddus (30th Mäggabit), Libanos/Mäṭaʿ (3rd Ṭǝrr), Yared (11th Gǝnbot), King Kaleb (20th Gǝnbot) are not commemorated at all. It is possible that the Sǝnkǝssar for the entire year was written in only one codex, even though the division of the text into two codices has been a common practice – at least later. In this Ms. the end of the first half of the year (30th Yäkkatit) and the beginning of the second half (1st Mäggabit) are written on the same folio (fol. 104ra). The whole text is written in the same hand. However, a division of this comprehensive text in a different way could be also possible.

extras.extra:
- Spaces left for rubrication are occasionally not filled: e.g., fols. 83v-85v: initial lines of the commemorative notices for 29th and 30th Ṭǝrr.
- The beginning of the first commemorative notice for some of the months were again crudely written in a secondary hand: for Ṭǝqǝmt: fol. 19vb for Yäkkatit: fol. 85vb, for Gǝnbot: fol. 143va-vb.
- Words/passages referring to or correcting the text are written in the lower margin of fols. 11v, 12v, 37v. - A few corrections are written over erased words and passages: e.g., fols. 87va, 88rb, 89va, 165va. - Simple drawings: fols. 18v, 69, 170v. - Scribbles in ink, pen and pencil: fols. 12v, 38v, 61r, 169v, 170v.
